question_text: A car accelerates uniformly from rest and travels a distance of 18 m in 3.0 seconds. The speed of the car at 3.0 seconds is
A ball is thrown vertically upwards and then falls back to its starting position. Which of the following acceleration-time graphs represents the motion of the ball?
A force of 10.0 N pulls a trolley of mass 2.0 kg along a horizontal surface. The total frictional force acting on the trolley is 6.0 N. The acceleration of the trolley is

A block of wood of mass 3.5 kg slides down a slope. The block of wood has a constant acceleration of 2.3 m/s² down the slope. The force of friction acting on the block is 6.4 N. The angle of the slope is
An object is released from rest at a height of 1.6 m above the ground. The mass of the object is 0.20 kg. The maximum speed of the object just before it hits the ground is

A ball of mass 0.164 kg is dropped from rest and falls towards the ground. The ball collides with the ground and rebounds upwards. The speed of the ball just before it hits the ground is 4.85 m/s. The ball is in contact with the ground for 0.180 s. The speed of the ball immediately after it rebounds from the ground is 3.96 m/s. The mean force exerted by the ball on the ground during the collision is

Two samples of modelling clay, X and Y, have the same shape and mass. Sample X is made of a softer clay than sample Y. The samples are both released from the same height and fall towards the ground. Both samples come to rest when they collide with the ground. A student makes the following statements about the samples colliding with the ground.

I Sample X comes to rest in less time than sample Y.
II The mean force exerted by the ground on sample X is less than the mean force exerted by the ground on sample Y.
III The change in momentum of sample X is less than the change in momentum of sample Y.

Which of these statements is/are correct?

The Large Hadron Collider (LHC) is contained in a circular tunnel. A technician working at the LHC measures the length of the tunnel to be 26.7 km. Protons in the tunnel are accelerated to a speed of 0.999c. The length of the tunnel in the frame of reference of the protons is

A student makes the following statements about cosmic microwave background radiation.

I Cosmic microwave background radiation provides evidence for the Big Bang theory.
II Cosmic microwave background radiation reaches the Earth from all directions.
III Measurements of the peak wavelength of cosmic microwave background radiation indicate that the average temperature of the Universe was lower in the past than it is now.

Which of these statements is/are correct?

The following statement represents a nuclear reaction. X represents

The light meter is now moved until the irradiance is 80 mW/m². The distance between the lamp and the light meter is now

Ultraviolet radiation of wavelength 250 nm is incident on a metal surface. The work function of the metal is 3.1 x 10⁻¹⁹ J. The energy of each photon of the ultraviolet radiation is

A student sets up the apparatus shown to produce an interference pattern. S1 and S2 provide coherent sources of microwave radiation. A radiation detector is moved along the line from P to Q. The first minimum is detected at point X. The distance from S1 to X is 300 mm. The distance from S2 to X is 250 mm. The second minimum is detected at Y. The path difference S1Y - S2Y is
A ray of monochromatic light passes through a glass block into air as shown. The critical angle for the glass block is 37.0° for this light. Angle X is

A ray of monochromatic light in air has speed c, wavelength λ, and frequency f. The ray of light passes from air into a substance. The refractive index of the substance is 2.0 for this light. Which row in the table shows the speed, wavelength, and frequency of the light in the substance?
A circuit is set up as shown. The total resistance between X and Y is
In the circuits shown below, the lamps are identical. The power supply has negligible internal resistance. In which circuit is the greatest power dissipated in the lamp?

A 7.0 Ω resistor is connected to a cell as shown. The internal resistance of the cell is 3.0 Ω. The switch is now closed. The reading on the ammeter is 0.15 A. Which row in the table shows the EMF of the cell and the reading on the voltmeter?

A battery has an EMF of 12 V and an internal resistance of 0.40 Ω. Two identical resistors each of resistance R are connected to the battery as shown. The reading on the ammeter is 4.0 A. The resistance R is

A student makes the following statements about red and blue LEDs.

I The gap between the valence band and the conduction band is larger for red LEDs than blue LEDs.
II Red LEDs emit photons of longer wavelength than blue LEDs.
III The potential difference across an LED determines the wavelength of the photons emitted.

Which of these statements is/are correct?

A student measures the acceleration of a toy car down a slope. The experiment is repeated and the following values for the acceleration are recorded.

0.28 m/s² 0.29 m/s² 0.34 m/s² 0.30 m/s² 0.29 m/s²

Which row in the table shows the mean value of the acceleration and the approximate random uncertainty in the mean value of the acceleration?
table_headers: Mean value of the acceleration (m/s²) | Approximate random uncertainty (m/s²)

question_text:
A black hole can be formed from a star which has become so massive it collapses under its own gravitational force. The radius r of a black hole is calculated using the relationship shown.

Where:
G is the Universal Constant of Gravitation
M is the mass of the star
c is the speed of light

A star of mass 1.99 x 10³¹ kg collapses to form a black hole. The radius of this black hole is
A cyclist travelling along a straight track accelerates at 1.2 m s⁻². The speed of the cyclist increases from 4.0 m s⁻¹ to 7.5 m s⁻¹. The distance travelled by the cyclist during this acceleration is
A ball is thrown vertically upwards and falls back to Earth. Neglecting air resistance, which velocity-time graph represents the motion of the ball?

A box of mass 6.0 kg is pulled along a horizontal bench by a force of 40 N. The angle between the force and the bench is 30°. The box moves at a constant speed. The frictional force acting on the box is
Two boxes on a frictionless horizontal surface are joined by a string. A force of 24 N pulls box Q. Mass of P is 2.0 kg, Mass of Q is 6.0 kg. The tension in the string joining the boxes is

A planet of mass M and a star of mass m are separated by a distance r. The magnitude of the gravitational force between them is F. The planet is moved to a distance of 3r from the star. The magnitude of the gravitational force is now

A spaceship is travelling at 0.40 c relative to Earth. An observer on the spaceship measures the time taken for the spaceship to travel between two points to be 7.0 hours. An observer on Earth measures the time taken for this journey to be
The graph shows the force acting on an object of mass 0.50 kg over a period of time. The change in momentum of the object is:
The redshift of light from a distant galaxy is 0.080. The approximate distance to this galaxy is
Which of the following provides evidence for the existence of dark matter?
option_a: The high temperature of the solar corona
option_b: The expansion rate of the universe
option_c: The estimation of the mass of galaxies
option_d: The abundance of light elements in the universe
option_e: The existence of the cosmic microwave background radiation

question_text: An electron is released from rest at plate X and accelerates towards plate Y. The separation of the plates is 40 mm. The p.d. between them is 2.5 kV. The force on the electron is:

In the following nuclear reaction, the particle represented by X is:
A student investigates the relationship between irradiance I and distance d from a point source of light. Which graph shows this relationship?
The diagram shows energy levels for an atom. The transition corresponding to the emission of a photon with the lowest frequency is:
A wave is displayed on an oscilloscope. The timebase is set to 2.5 ms/div. The frequency of the wave is:
Light from a laser passes through a grating. The separation of the slits is 4.0 × 10⁻⁶ m. The angle between the zero order and the second order maximum is 18°. The wavelength of the light is:
A ray of red light passes through a glass prism. The refractive index of the glass for this light is 1.48. Angle θ is:
The absolute refractive index of a medium is 1.6. Which row shows the speed of light in the medium and the critical angle?
Three resistors are connected to a 6.0 V battery. The power dissipated in the 30 Ω resistor is:
Four circuit diagrams are shown. Which diagrams show a voltmeter connected to measure the EMF of the cell?
A Wheatstone bridge circuit is shown. The reading on the voltmeter is 0 V. The resistance of R is:
A capacitor is charged by a constant current of 3.0 × 10⁻⁴ A. Which pair of graphs shows how Charge Q and Current I vary with time t?
The diagrams show valence and conduction bands for X, Y, Z. Which row identifies them?
An increase in the temperature of a semiconductor
option_a: increases conductivity by allowing more electrons to reach conduction band
option_b: increases conductivity by increasing band gap
option_c: decreases conductivity by allowing more electrons to reach conduction band
option_d: decreases conductivity by allowing fewer electrons to reach conduction band
